definitions.definition: The physical means or contrivances to make something (especially a public service) possible; the required equipment, infrastructure , location etc.
examples: Transport facilities in Bangkok are not sufficient to prevent frequent traffic collapses during rush hour.

definitions.definition: A building or campus specially designed for a specific purpose, such as incarceration, military use, or scientific experimentation.
The fact of being easy , or easily done; absence of difficulty; simplicity .
Dexterity of speech or action; skill , talent .
examples: The facility she shows in playing the violin is unrivalled.

definitions.definition: A condition of mental weakness less than idiocy , but enough to make a person easily persuaded to do something against their better interest.

main_definition: The physical means or contrivances to make something (especially a public service) possible; the required equipment, infrastructure , location etc. [from 19th c.]
secondary_definitions: A building or campus specially designed for a specific purpose, such as incarceration, military use, or scientific experimentation.
The fact of being easy , or easily done; absence of difficulty; simplicity . [from 16th c.]
Dexterity of speech or action; skill , talent . [from 16th c.]
( finance , banking ) Clipping of credit facility .
( Canada , US , in the plural ) A toilet . [from 20th c.]
( Scots law ) A condition of mental weakness less than idiocy , but enough to make a person easily persuaded to do something against their better interest.
